tutorial.title: Forms with Labels
tutorial.descriptionContent: Learn how to add labels to your form in HTML

lessons.title: Labels
lessons.interactiveContent:
In forms, labels are important for defining the expected inputs. Fill in label inside of the blank space.

Make sure to type label.

lessons.title: Label Element
lessons.interactiveContent:
We create a label by using the <label> and </label> tags.

Make sure to pick <label>, followed by </label>.

lessons.title: Labels Text
lessons.interactiveContent:
We add text to labels to help users know what to input. Add Email as the text after the second label tag.

Make sure to pick Email.

lessons.title: for attribute
lessons.interactiveContent:
The for attribute specifies which input element a label is bound to. Its value is the same as the id value of the input element.

Make sure to type for.

lessons.title: for attribute #2
lessons.interactiveContent:
The for attribute value must be the same as the value of the id of the corresponding input element. Add "email" as a value for the for attribute.

Make sure to pick email.

lessons.title: Labels Accessibility
lessons.interactiveContent:
Labels also help with accessibility. Screen readers will audibly read labels like Name: or Email: when the input element is in focus.

Additionally, when a user clicks on the label, the connected input element will be focused on.

Make sure to pick Name, followed by Email.

lessons.title: Placeholders
lessons.interactiveContent:
We can use placeholder attributes within input fields to work as labels. However, this is not a complete replacement for labels.

Make sure to pick placeholder.

lessons.title: Question: Labels
lessons.interactiveContent:
Why do we use labels in forms?

We use labels to define what the users should put into the inputWe use labels as an alternative to paragraphs in HTML

We use labels to define what the users should put into the input.

lessons.title: Question: Label Element
lessons.interactiveContent:
What's wrong with the code?

It should use label elements instead of p elementsThere shouldn't be any line break elements

It should use label elements instead of p elements.

lessons.title: Question: Labels Text
lessons.interactiveContent:
What does the label for the email input say?

Email Address:Age:

Email Address:.

lessons.title: Question: for attribute
lessons.interactiveContent:
Why do we use the for attribute in a label element?

To link between the input element and the label elementTo describe the type of label element

To link between the input element and the label element.

lessons.title: Question: for attribute #2
lessons.interactiveContent:
What should the for attribute of the Rating label be in order to connect it to the input with id="rating"?

ratingreview

Make sure to pick rating.

lessons.title: Question: Labels Accessibility
lessons.interactiveContent:
How do labels help with accessibility?

Screen readers will read the label when the input element is focused onLabels provide visual text for inputs

Screen readers will read the label when the input element is focused on.

lessons.title: Question: Placeholders
lessons.interactiveContent:
What does this code display?

A form with a textbox input with the text Zipcode insideA form with a label with the text Zipcode next to an input

A form with a textbox input with the text Zipcode inside.

lessons.title: Example: Labels
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code the label element's opening tag.

Make sure to type <label>.

lessons.title: Exercise: Labels Text
lessons.interactiveContent:
Create a label with the text Address:.

Make sure to pick <label>, followed by Address:, and finally </label>.

lessons.title: Exercise: for attribute
lessons.interactiveContent:
Fill in the for attribute in the label to match the id of the donation amount input field.

Make sure to type donation.

lessons.title: Exercise: for attribute #2
lessons.interactiveContent:
Add a for attribute in the label attribute to match the id of the input for job.

Make sure to type for="job".

lessons.title: Example: Labels Accessibility
lessons.interactiveContent:
Add the correct label element with the text Language:.

Make sure to pick <label for="language">, followed by Language:, and finally </label>.

lessons.title: Exercise: Placeholders
lessons.interactiveContent:
Set a placeholder for the input as an alternative to using a label.

Make sure to pick placeholder, followed by =, and finally "Enter Code".
